citations.narrative:
Some adult dogs (born and raised at the facility) did not have their official tag assigned to them but they were identifiable
in the records. Adult dogs must be identified by an official tag to ensure easy recognition and tracking of animal
husbandry. Ensure that each adult dog is properly identified by an official tag as required and is affixed to the animal's
neck by means of a collar made of material generally considered acceptable to pet owners as a means of identifying their
pet dogs or cats, or is be identified by a distinctive and legible tattoo marking acceptable to and approved by the
Administrator.
***Correct by November 1, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.50(a)(1) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
Some adult dogs (born and raised at the facility) did not have their official tag assigned to them but they were identifiable 
in the records. Adult dogs must be identified by an official tag to ensure easy recognition and tracking of animal 
husbandry. Ensure that each adult dog is properly identified by an official tag as required and is affixed to the animal's 
neck by means of a collar made of material generally considered acceptable to pet owners as a means of identifying their 
pet dogs or cats, or is be identified by a distinctive and legible tattoo marking acceptable to and approved by the 
Administrator. 
***Correct by November 1, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
